section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience.
explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction. The first sentence establishes a clear financial obligation for the customer to pay a specific amount ($450) monthly. The second sentence then undermines this obligation by stating the customer pays 'at their discretion and convenience.' This contradicts the first sentence, because this suggests the customer can pay whenever or if they want, which could nullify the payment terms.

section: The term of this Agreement for the Hosted Site shall commence upon April 1, 1999 and shall continue for a period of six (6) months, unless earlier terminated in accordance with provisions hereof. This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term.
explanation: This section contains an in-text contradiction regarding the renewal term. It initially states the agreement renews for 'one (1) or more one (1) month periods'. This is ambiguous because 'one or more' could mean multiple one-month renewals consecutively, or renewing for more than one month at a time. It then further contradicts itself when it requires a fifteen (15) days' notice before the end of the 'respective initial or renewal term'. Because the renewal term is defined as 'one (1) or more one (1) month periods', this contradicts the initial 6 month agreement and also introduces unclarity.

section: i-on will be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
explanation: This section presents an in-text contradiction. The first sentence states that i-on will never be liable for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if they were informed of their possibility. The second sentence then contradicts this by stating that i-on is liable for damages up to one month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees. These statements are logically inconsistent: the first implies zero liability for certain damages, while the second acknowledges a limited liability for any damages.
